email_settings.sending_custom: You will have to manually send the PDF to your client. Instead, you can save time and send it directly from Kernel using one of the two options above.
email_settings.sending_kernel: The invoice will be sent via Kernel’s email which means that there’s a risk it might end up in the receiver’s “Promotions” or another email tab.
email_settings.sending_smtp_blocked: The invoice will be sent through your company email, guaranteeing that it arrives at the client’s inbox. This feature is really easy to set up and is included in our paid plans.
email_settings.sending_smtp_allowed: The invoice will be sent through your company email, guaranteeing that it arrives at the client’s inbox.

validation.alpha: The {_field_} field may only contain alphabetic characters
validation.alpha_num: The {_field_} field may only contain alpha-numeric characters
validation.alpha_dash: The {_field_} field may contain alpha-numeric characters as well as dashes and underscores
validation.alpha_spaces: The {_field_} field may only contain alphabetic characters as well as spaces
validation.between: The {_field_} field must be between {min} and {max}
validation.confirmed: The {_field_} field confirmation does not match
validation.digits: The {_field_} field must be numeric and exactly contain {length} digits
validation.dimensions: The {_field_} field must be {width} pixels by {height} pixels
validation.email: The {_field_} field must be a valid email
validation.excluded: The {_field_} field is not a valid value
validation.ext: The {_field_} field is not a valid file
validation.image: The {_field_} field must be an image
validation.integer: The {_field_} field must be an integer
validation.max_value: The {_field_} field must be {max} or less
validation.max: The {_field_} field may not be greater than {length} characters
validation.mimes: The {_field_} field must have a valid file type
validation.min_value: The {_field_} field must be {min} or more
validation.min: The {_field_} field must be at least {length} characters
validation.numeric: The {_field_} field may only contain numeric characters
validation.oneOf: The {_field_} field is not a valid value
validation.size: The {_field_} field size must be less than {size}KB
validation.name_and_id_matches: Name or Tax ID matches to another account Name or Tax ID

warnings.insufficient_permissions: You do not have sufficient permission to perform the action

ogs.base_description: A professional financial tools platform for small businesses and freelancers

step0.body:
Now, we’ll introduce you to all the important functionality so
you can make a better use of it.

It will only take about 10 seconds.

intro.step1:
This is the company’s dashboard. Here,
you see all the existing invoices and
track of the key metrics of the
business.
intro.step2:
This is where you keep rack of all your cash
flows and revenues. Also, it's the place
where you can gain most insights into your
numbers.
intro.step3:
From here you can add a new company,
invite users and edit your or company
settings.
intro.step4: You'll be able to create invoice here.
intro.step5: Keep track of your revenue and cash flow from here.
intro.step7: Click here to create your first invoice. We'll guide you through the process.
intro.inv1: You can change invoice status from here.
intro.inv2: Every invoice is automatically assigned a unique code. You can change it if necessary.
intro.inv3: Your profile logo will automatically show up here. To add a new one click the button.
intro.inv4: Fill in your information. It will automatically be filled in future invoices.
intro.inv6: In order to search for existing clients use the search field. To add new ones click "Add New Customer".
intro.inv7: Add items, their quantity and price.
intro.inv8: Here you can manage your VAT rate.
intro.inv9: Fill in your bank information. It will automatically be filled in future invoices.
intro.inv10: This box is pre-filled with standard text. You can change it.
intro.inv11: Here you can choose whether you want to save the invoice, see PDF or send it to the client.

tooltips.days_left_footer: You have {days} day(s) left in your {plan} plan. To view other plans click Upgrade.
tooltips.days_left_footer_basic: You have the free plan activated. To view other plans click Upgrade.
tooltips.new_country: To add Country you have to create new company.

dialog.you_just_upgraded_plans: You just upgraded your Kernel plan!
dialog.you_just_activated_free_trial: You’ve successfully activated your 14 days Free Trial!
dialog.upgrade_to_create_more: Upgrade your plan to create more.
dialog.upgrade_to_use: Upgrade your account to access this functionality.
dialog.good_news: We have a good news for you!
dialog.trial_version_for_georgians: As one of our first customer, We want to deliver to you, the selected package, for free of charge, for one month.
dialog.click_to_activate: Press the button to activate package.
dialog.offer_free_trial: Here’s a 14 days Free Trial. Just click the button the activate it.

all.title: Simple Financial Calculators
all.description: Free online easy-to-use financial calculators for taxes, financial ratios, loans: VAT calculator, break-even-point calculator, loan payment calculator, etc.

bepc.title: Break-Even Point Calculator
bepc.description: The Break-even point (BEP) is the amount of revenue or sales required to cover the total costs - that is, fixed and variable costs combined.

cagrc.title: Compound Growth Rate Calculator
cagrc.description: The compound annual growth rate tells us the average growth rate for an investment over a period of time. Learn how to calculate it for yourself.

depric.title: Depreciation Calculator
depric.description: There are numerous ways to calculate depreciation, but today, we’ll cover three main types of it: Linear Method, Double Declining Balance, Units Of Production.

grmrgc.title: Gross Margin Calculator
grmrgc.description: The percentage of sales that the company retains after covering direct costs associated with creating a service or product that was sold.

lpmtc.title: Loan Down Payment Calculator
lpmtc.description: On the level of intuition, we all understand what a loan is. But only a few know what mechanism stands behind it or how the loan down payment is calculated.

netprfc.title: Net Profit Calculator
netprfc.description: The income statement gives you all the information you need about your operating and non-operating expenses, as well as revenue streams and net profit (income).

vatc.title: VAT Calculator
vatc.description: A value-added tax, known in some countries as a goods and services tax. Let’s see if it applies to you and how you can calculate it.

salc.title: Personal Income Tax Calculator
salc.description: What Is And How To Calculate Personal Income Tax

prptc.title: Property Tax Calculator
prptc.description: What Is And How To Calculate Property Tax

qrcal.title: Quick Ratio Calculator
qrcal.description: The quick ratio is a liquidity ratio that measures a company's ability to pay its current liabilities. Learn how to calculate it for your business.

currat.title: Current Ratio Calculator
currat.description: The current ratio is a liquidity ratio that measures a company's ability to pay its current liabilities with cash generated from its current assets.

description_tooltips.recurring_invoices: On this page you can create recurring invoices. If you sure the automatic send function, then they will automatically be sent to your clients according to the schedule you set up.

create_invoice.status_indicator:
The status of your invoice indicates whether it has been paid for or not.

From here you can change the status of your invoice. This helps you organize your invoice archive better and improve reporting.
create_invoice.invoice_id:
Invoice ID is a unique number assigned to each invoice you create. You can go ahead and customize it or leave it up to us.

We'll automatically generate unique and successive numbers for each new invoice you create.
create_invoice.seller_details:
The invoice must clearly state your (seller's) name and contact information so that the customer can contact you for any queries about the billing or service.

Click on the edit button and make sure you fill out all the mandatory fields, the ones marked with '*'. The entered information will be saved and pre-filled in all your future invoices.
create_invoice.invoice_information:
It's mandatory for every invoice to clearly state the issuing and payment dates as well the method of payment, whether it's cash, bank transfer, or any other kind.

For simplicity, the invoice date is pre-filled with the current date and the payment terms are set to cash payment.
create_invoice.buyer:
Every invoice must be addressed to someone - a buyer. It's absolutely necessary for he client's contact info to be included.

If you haven't added a customer yet, go ahead and click Add New Customer right bellow and make sure you fill out all the mandatory fields marked with '*'.
create_invoice.table_header:
The invoice must describe each product or type of service provided. This includes name of the product in question, quantity of it being sold, the unit in which the quantity is measured and the price per piece.

The net amount is calculated automatically based on the price and quantity.
create_invoice.vat: Make sure whether you have to pay tax on your products. If you do, then double-check the tax percentage. If you don't then you can put it to zero or turn it off from settings.
create_invoice.banking_information:
If you choose bank transfer as your payment term you need to include your banking information for the customer to transfer payments to your account.

Click the edit button bellow and create a reusable banking account>/b> for all your future invoices.

invoices.main_description:
This is your dashboard. From here, you control all your existing invoices and track revenues, cash flow and other key metrics of your business.

On the left, there’s the navigation panel for you to easily surft the application.
invoices.overdue: This is sum of outstanding amounts that haven't been paid on time.
invoices.revenue: This if how much you've earned during this month.
invoices.due_in_7: This is how much you're expecting to earn during next seven days.
invoices.search:
You can search your invoice archive by several queries. This includes filtering by individual customer, which you can set up in the Customers section on the left.

Filtering by their status, whether it's paid, unpaid, draft or overdue. Filtering by dates of issuing and payment and of course if you need to find a specific invoice you can use the invoice ID search querie.
invoices.category:
This is your invoice archive. Here you can find all the invoices you've ever created and take a look at their basic information, such as status, days left until due date, etc.

Additionally, you can easily filter the archive by clicking on the invoice statuses to your left in order to display the invoices with a specific status, such as 'Paid'.

reports.main_description:
This is where you keep track of all your cash flows and revenues. Also, it's the place where you will gain most insights into your numbers. These reports are automatically refreshed with every new invoice you create.

Whether you want to analyze your income per customer, take a look at your aged receivables or break down the revenue by month, it's all here and ready for you to use.
reports.export: Export function allows you do download the data from Kernel to your computer. This way you can easily share all your documents with your accounting team and reduce friction.
reports.export_modal:
Export function allows you do download the data from Kernel to your computer. This way you can easily share all your documents with your accounting team and reduce friction.

You can export the list of all your invoices either as PDF of Excel file or choose the period for which you want to perform the export.

customers.main_description:
Here, you can manage your existing customers base and add new ones.

All the customer profiles created here can be easily be added to your invoices or billed straight from their profiles.

Additionally, this space allows you to manage and store all your client info in an organized environment.
customers.add_new_customer: Fill in all the necessary information (fields with '*') to create a customer profile. It will be saved in your customers list and can be re-used in all your future invoices.
customers.bill_this_customer:
You can bill this customer directly by clicking this button.

A new invoice with this client as a recipient will be automatically generated. You'll just have to add products and it'll be good to go.
customers.basic_information:
Customer profile created here will be automatically saved to you customers list and can be reused in future invoices.

Make sure you fill out all the mandatory fields marked with '*'.

new_customer.name: Include a legal name of the customer.
new_customer.tax_id: Unique set of numbers that identifies individuals and companies for tax purposes. It can be found on tax returns.

products.main_description:
You can manage your existing product base here, as well as add new ones to be added to your future invoices.

In order to add items to your invoice click on Add from Products while creating your invoice and from the list choose the one you want to add.
products.new_product_modal: The product you create here will be automatically be saved in your products list and can be re-used in all your future invoices with just one click.

account_settings.name: Include a legal name of your company.
account_settings.tax_id: Unique set of numbers that identifies individuals and companies for tax purposes. You can find this number on your tax returns.
account_settings.vat_payer: The laws about being a VAT payer differ country-by-country, so make sure you're a VAT payer before checking this option.
account_settings.currency:
Set the currency in which all your invoices will be issued. Currently we only support single currency transactions. Which means that all your invoices should have the same currency.

Once you set the currency and register a payment you won't be able to change it to anything else ultil you delete all your existing invoices.
account_settings.choose_template: You can choose your invoice template from here. This template applies to all your existing and future invoices/
account_settings.banking_information:
This is the banking information that is included in your invoices as your (seller's) credentials.

If you choose bank transfer as your payment term you need to include your banking information for the customer to transfer payments to your account.

You can create pre-sets of your bank accounts here for you to re-use them in your invoices.

whats_new_modal.manage_invoices: You can manage invoices and cash flows for all your companies with one account.
whats_new_modal.add_your_teammates: Add your teammates to your company space to start working together.
whats_new_modal.create_and_schedule_recurring_invoices: We can now create and schedule recurring invoices to be sent automatically.
whats_new_modal.import_all_your_clients_and_products: Import all your customers and products to your company’s workspace.
whats_new_modal.which_one: Which one do you want to import?

invited_user_modal.question: Do you want us to show you around the new company?

invoice_edit_modal.warning: You are about to modifying the <b>Closed<b/> invoice. Please let your customer know about the changes.

before_leave_save_modal.text: Do you want to save the changes before you exit?
